name: POCIT (People of Color in Tech)
description: World's leading platform for underrepresented in tech to share, grow, and get hired. Provides content, community, and career opportunities.
key_programs: Job board (pocitjobs.com), articles, podcast, career resources

name: Blacks In Technology (BIT)
description: Largest community of Black people in the technology industry. 'Stomping the Divide' through training, education, networking, and mentorship.
key_programs: BITCON annual conference, Slack community, LinkedIn group, job board, local chapters

name: Masakhane
description: Grassroots organization for NLP research in African languages. 'We Build Together' - developing open-source ML tools for African languages.
key_programs: Machine translation models, NER, speech recognition, Google Colab notebooks, weekly meetings, Slack workspace

name: Techqueria
description: Largest global community of Latinx professionals in tech. Provides mentorship, career development, and DEI advocacy.
key_programs: Slack community, job board, local chapters, annual summit, mentorship programs

name: /dev/color
description: Nonprofit focused on maximizing the impact of Black software engineers through career development and networking.
key_programs: A* Program for networking and career mapping, events, meetings, retreats

name: Black Professional in Tech Network (BPTN)
description: Global network connecting large tech companies with Black tech professionals through employment opportunities and resources.
key_programs: Obsidi platform, recruitment services, mentorship, educational resources, awards ceremony

name: AISES
description: American Indian Science and Engineering Society - advancing Indigenous peoples in STEM studies and careers.
key_programs: Scholarships, national conference, career development, internships, STEM curriculum support

name: Natives in Tech
description: Nonprofit providing spaces for American Indian tech professionals to network and build open-source technology.
key_programs: Annual conference, open-source projects, community networking

name: Code2040
description: Career advancement platform for Black, Latinx, and Native American students and professionals in tech.
key_programs: Fellows Program, Early Career Accelerator, mentorship, community building

name: Latinas in Tech
description: Nonprofit connecting, supporting, and empowering Latina women in technology through training and mentorship.
key_programs: Professional development, recruiting partnerships, mentorship, annual summit, 20+ global chapters

name: Black Women Talk Tech
description: Annual conference and community for Black women entrepreneurs and professionals in tech.
key_programs: Annual conference, 10 national/international mastermind groups, networking

name: Black Girls CODE
description: Nonprofit introducing programming and technology to young girls of color.
key_programs: Coding workshops, summer camps, hackathons, mentorship

name: AfroTech
description: Multicultural tech conference and media platform highlighting Black tech innovators and their stories.
key_programs: Annual conference, media platform, job board, networking events

name: We Build Black
description: Tech community for Black software engineers to share ideas, work on code, and discuss the industry.
key_programs: Weekly meetups, Slack conversations, collaborative coding

name: Black Code Collective
description: Community for Black developers to help each other grow tech skills and level-up careers.
key_programs: Community support, knowledge sharing, career development

name: Valence
description: Recruitment platform connecting, empowering, and showcasing Black professionals (acquired by Greenwood).
key_programs: Recruitment platform, career opportunities, networking

name: SHPE
description: Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers - supporting Hispanics in STEM for nearly 50 years.
key_programs: Mentorship, programming, annual conference, scholarships, career development

name: Kapor Center
description: Nonprofit expanding access and equity in tech through research, advocacy, and community building.
key_programs: Research reports, policy advocacy, Leaky Tech Pipeline research, Native Tech ecosystem reports

name: Per Scholas
description: Nonprofit providing tuition-free tech training to underrepresented communities. 85% of learners are PoC.
key_programs: Tech training programs, Diverse by Design initiative, career placement

name: Noirefy
description: Platform connecting underrepresented professionals with high-growth startups and Fortune 500 companies.
key_programs: Job matching, company connections, career opportunities

name: Girls Who Code
description: Nonprofit dedicated to closing the gender gap in tech. Founded by Reshma Saujani.
key_programs: Summer programs, clubs, college programs, alumni support

name: AI4ALL
description: Nonprofit increasing diversity and inclusion in AI education and careers.
key_programs: Summer programs, open learning resources, college pathways program

name: Latino Business Action Network (LBAN)
description: Empowering Latino entrepreneurs through research, education, and startup accelerator programs.
key_programs: Startup accelerator, Stanford Latino Entrepreneurship Initiative, research

name: Latinx Startup Alliance
description: Encouraging and cultivating Latinx-led tech startup ventures through networking and mentorship.
key_programs: Founder support network, mentors, advisors, partners

name: Outdoor Afro
description: National network celebrating and inspiring Black connections and leadership in nature through outdoor recreation.
community_size: 100+ volunteer leaders in 60 cities, 60,000+ participants annually
key_programs: Hiking, kayaking, birding, fishing, swimming, leadership training (OALT), volunteer programs

name: Travel Noire
description: Media platform and community for Black travelers, featuring destinations, guides, and travel resources.
key_programs: Travel guides, destination features, newsletter, travel tips, content creation

name: Nomadness Travel Tribe
description: BIPOC travel lifestyle brand and community - 'Digital Green Book' for travelers of color. Founded by Evita Robinson.
key_programs: Online community, group trips, Audacity Fest, meetups worldwide

name: Melanin Base Camp
description: Storytelling platform promoting diversity in outdoor adventure sports for Black, Latinx, Asian, Indigenous and LGBTQ+ adventurers.
key_programs: Blog content, Diversify Outdoors coalition, #melaninbasecamp hashtag campaign

name: Latino Outdoors
description: Latinx-led organization engaging Latino communities in outdoor recreation, embracing cultura y familia.
key_programs: Vamos Outdoors (hiking, camping, birding), Yo Cuento Outdoors storytelling, Jobs+ board, leadership development

name: Diversify Outdoors
description: Coalition of digital influencers, entrepreneurs and consultants advocating for equitable and inclusive outdoors.
key_programs: Coalition building, Outdoor CEO Diversity Pledge, social media campaigns, resource sharing

name: Black & Abroad
description: Cultural collective dedicated to redefining world experiences for the modern Black traveler.
key_programs: Travel content, merchandise, experiences, travel planning resources

name: Soul Trak Outdoors
description: Connecting urban communities of color to green spaces through hiking, climbing, camping, and education.
key_programs: Youth programs, adult programs, student ambassador program (Howard University), documentary viewings

name: Blackpackers
description: Colorado-based organization creating economic equity in outdoor recreation and career pipelines.
key_programs: Career pipeline programs, gear access, outdoor education

name: Vibe Tribe Adventures
description: Denver-based organization leading outdoor recreation programs for BIPOC communities.
key_programs: Guided outdoor programs, community events, gear rental

name: Indigenous Women Hike
description: Healing through inherent connection to the land for Indigenous women.
key_programs: Hiking events, healing journeys, community building

name: Native Womens Wilderness
description: Inspiring and raising voices of Native Women in the outdoor realm, encouraging healthy wilderness lifestyle.
key_programs: Outdoor events, storytelling, community building, wilderness education

name: Natives Outdoors
description: Empowering indigenous communities through products and storytelling for a sustainable world.
key_programs: Apparel, storytelling, community building, sustainability advocacy

name: Brown Girls Climb
description: Community for Brown women climbers to connect, share experiences, and support each other.
key_programs: Climbing events, community building, representation

name: Climbers of Color
description: Initiative to increase alpine and mountaineering expertise among People of Color outdoor educators.
key_programs: Mountaineering training, educator development, alpine skills

name: Hike Clerb
description: Intersectional womxn's hike club creating inclusive outdoor spaces.
key_programs: Group hikes, community events, intersectional focus

name: Outdoor Asian
description: Building a community of Asians & Pacific Islanders in the outdoors.
key_programs: Community building, outdoor events, representation

name: QPOC Hikers
description: Pacific Northwest-based community connecting queer people of color with hiking and outdoors.
key_programs: Hiking events, storytelling, visibility, learning opportunities

name: National Brotherhood of Skiers
description: Supporting Black participation in skiing and snowboarding through financial support and community.
key_programs: Olympic Scholarship Fund, skiing events, community building

name: Team Blackstar Skydivers
description: Online community of Black, Indigenous, Asian, Latinx and multiracial skydivers.
key_programs: Annual events, community building, diversity in skydiving

name: Black Girls Travel Too
description: Travel community and tour company for Black women, prioritizing small intimate groups.
key_programs: Small group tours, travel community, authentic experiences

name: Hunters of Color
description: Community for BIPOC hunters to connect and share experiences.
key_programs: Hunting community, education, representation

name: Latino Community Fund - Latinos in Tech Washington
description: Washington State organization fostering equitable tech sector and STEM access for Latino community.
key_programs: Tech sector equity, STEM opportunities, community leadership

name: Color My Outdoors
description: Community promoting outdoor recreation and equity for Black and Brown communities in the Southeast.
key_programs: Outdoor storytelling, leadership programs, skill-building workshops, financial aid for outdoor activities
